data.chText: 衰落；衰败；垮台；衰落（或衰败、垮台）的原因
data.enText: the loss of a person's money, power, social position, etc.; the thing that causes this

data.chText: 这桩绯闻最终使他身败名裂。
data.enText: The sex scandal finally led to his downfall.

data.chText: 贪得无厌就是她堕落的缘由。

means: 衰落(或衰败、垮台)的原因

tr: failure that results in a loss of position or reputation
a sudden decline in strength or number or importance
example: the fall of the House of Hapsburg

tr: the falling to earth of any form of water (rain or snow or hail or sleet or mist)

value.def: The downfall of a successful or powerful person or institution is their loss of success or power.

example.ex: His lack of experience had led to his downfall.
example.tran: 经验不足导致了他的下台。

example.ex: ...people wishing to see the downfall of the government.
example.tran: 希望看到政府倒台的人们

gramarinfo.label: also N in pl, usu with poss

value.def: The thing that was a person's downfall caused them to fail or lose power.

example.ex: His honesty had been his downfall...

example.tran: 艾伦栽在了“女人”这两个字上。
